revision.comment: [[WP:AES|←]]Created page with 'Parracombe is the name of a Bagueley diesel locomotive that currently resides on the [[Groudle Glen Railway]] in the [[Isle of Man]] in private ownership. It has n...'
revision.text:
Parracombe is the name of a Bagueley diesel locomotive that currently resides on the [[Groudle Glen Railway]] in the [[Isle of Man]] in private ownership. It has not operated in service on the railway since arriving in 2007 from the [[Lynton and Barnstaple Railway]] in [[Devon]], where it had seen service on the [[Lynbarn Railway]] at the Milky Way theme park in [[Clovelly]]. It was built by Baguley (works No. 3232 of 1947) and once worked at [[Butlins]] [[Clacton]] Holiday Camp, from where it featured on the closing credits to the situation comedy [[Hi-De-Hi]] in the 1980s. Currently in store, it performed a very limited number of passenger services as part of an enthusiasts event in July 2007.
==See also== *[[Isle of Man Steam Railway Supporters' Association]] *[[British narrow gauge railways]]
==Links== * [http://www.groudleglenrailway.com The Official Site] * [http://www.isle-of-man.com/heritage/transport/ggr.htm Groudle Glen Railway] * [http://www.iomguide.com/groudleglenrailway.php Guide to the railway]
==References== * {{cite book|author=Tony Beard|title=Groudle Glen Railway: Its History & Restoration|publisher=Groudle Glen Railway|year=1994}} * ''Manx Steam Railway News'' Journal of the [[Isle of Man Steam Railway Supporters' Association]]
[[Category:Groudle Glen Railway]] [[Category:Heritage railways in the Isle of Man]] [[Category:Two foot gauge railways]] [[Category:Narrow gauge railways in the United Kingdom]]
[[fr:Chemin de fer de Groudle Glen]]

'''Giulio Chazalettes''' (*1930) is an Italian [[opera]] [[director]] and former [[actor]].
==Biography== He was born in [[Verona]]<ref>http://delteatro.it/dizionario_dello_spettacolo_del_900/c/chazalettes.php</ref> (according to another source in [[Torino]]<ref>http://www.bayerische.staatsoper.de/309-ZG9tPWRvbTMmaWQ9NDIwJmw9ZW4-~popups~k_biographie.html</ref>). He was taught in music by his mother, a [[German]] pianist. After having settled in [[Milan]], he was accepted by the [[Piccolo Teatro]]'s acting school. Soon he also joined the company, and appeared in ''Sacrilegio massimo'' by [[Stefano Landi]], and replaced [[Giorgio De Lullo]] in [[The Madwoman of Chaillot]]. Later he went to [[Dresden]] to work as an actor and assistant director. Returning to Italy, he finished his musical education at the [[Florence]] conservatory. Chazalettes then started his career as an opera director. In 1976, he debuted at [[La Scala]] with [[Massenet]]'s ''[[Werther]]'' (conducted by [[Georges Prêtre]]). His debut at the [[Vienna State Opera]] came in 1980 with [[Verdi]]'s ''[[Attila (opera)|Attila]]'' (conducted by [[Giuseppe Sinopoli]]). Chazalettes also worked for the [[Chicago Lyric Opera]] and the [[Bavarian State Opera]]. In 1989, he directed [[Frederica von Stade]] in Massenet's ''Cherubin'' for the [[Santa Fe Opera]], about which the [[New York Times]] wrote: ''"Giulio Chazalettes's staging adopts a broadly comical, burlesque-opera approach that emphasizes Cherubin's lack of discrimination in woman-chasing. The countess (Melanie Helton) and the baroness (Judith Christin) fluttered about as painted gargoyles, their grotesqueness contrasting sharply with the beauty of the boy's other loves, the dancer L'Ensoleillad (Karen Huffstodt) and the peasant girl Nina (Sheryl Woods). Subtler production styles could be imagined, certainly, but this one often tickled the work hilariously into life."''<ref>http://www.nytimes.com/1989/08/04/arts/review-opera-massenet-s-infrequently-performed-cherubin.html</ref> ==References== <references/>
{{DEFAULTSORT:Chazalettes, Giulio}} [[Category:1930 births]] [[Category:Italian actors]] [[Category:Opera directors]]

==The Young Earth-Scientists for Society (YES) Congress 2009==
===Background:=== The Young Earth-Scientists for Society (YES) Network was formed in 2008. The network is an association of earth-scientists who are primarily under the age of 35 years that represent geological organizations and companies from across the world. In collaboration with the International Year of Planet Earth (IYPE) the YES Network is organizing the [http://www.yescongress2009.org/ first international YES Congress] that will focus on global climate, environmental and geological challenges facing today’s society, as well as career and academic pathway challenges faced by young geoscientists. The conference also aims to establish an interdisciplinary global network of individuals committed to solving these challenges, and furthering the IYPE motto of “Earth Sciences for Society”. The conference will be hosted at [http://www.cugb.edu.cn/cugbhomepage.asp China University of Geosciences] in Beijing, China from 25 to 28 October.
===Format:=== ====Oral and Poster Sessions==== The conference will provide poster and oral sessions that will focus around the ten main themes of the IYPE, as well as three additional themes that are unique to the conference:
'''Oral and Poster Session Themes:''' # Groundwater –towards sustainable use # Hazards – minimizing risk, maximizing awareness # Earth & Health – building a safer environment # Climate - the “stone tape” # Resources –” towards sustainable use” # Megacities – going deeper, building safer # Deep Earth – from crust to core # Ocean – abyss of time # Soils – the living skin of the Earth # Earth & Life – origins of diversity # The Qinghai-Tibet Plateau uplift, changes and global changes # Digital Earth Engineering # Geoheritage Conversation and Geoparks
====Roundtable Symposia==== The conference will also provide roundtable symposia that aim to foster a prominent conversation between scientists, policy makers and society as a whole. The roundtables will include a series of short presentations by subject matter experts, a panel discussion and then working group sessions in which roundtable participants will work together to propose actions and tasks for the Y.E.S. Network to address in solving the issues raised by the roundtable session presentations and discussions. The roundtables will engage both senior and young geoscientists as both presenters and participants. Roundtables session deal with two main topics: scientific challenges of our generation and academic and career pathway challenges for young geoscientists.
'''Roundtable Symposia Themes: ''' * Climate Change in the Polar Regions * Natural Resources and Energy Sustainability * Natural Hazards
* Transfer of Credentials / International Licensure * Issues Facing Global Geoscience Education and Research * Women in the Geoscience Workforce * Industry-Academic Linkages: Connecting the needs of the workforce with the tools of the classroom
* Synthesis & Strategy - Summary of Roundtable Sessions
===Organizations Involved in the Congress:===
* [http://www.cugb.edu.cn/cugbhomepage.asp China University of Geosciences] * [http://yearofplanetearth.org/ International Year of Planet Earth]
* [http://www.agiweb.org American Geological Institute] * [http://www.arcticportal.org/apecs APECS] * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tanzania_Commission_for_Science_and_Technology Commission for Science and Technology of Tanzania] * [http://www.eurogeosurveys.org/ EuroGeoSurveys] * [http://www.geosociety.org/ Geological Society of America] * [http://www.socgeol.it/ Geological Society of Italy] * [http://www.geolsoc.org.uk/ Geological Society of London] * [http://www.geologi.no/ Geological Society of Norway] * [http://www.ga.gov.au/ Geoscience Australia] * [http://www.inqua.tcd.ie/ International Union for Quaternary Research] * [http://www.apat.gov.it/site/en-GB/ ISPRA] * [http://www.giovanigeologi.it/ Italian Geological Society- Young Section] * [http://www.iugs.org/ IUGS] * [http://www.pyrn.ways.org/ Permafrost Young Researchers Network] * [http://www.gov.uz/en/section.scm?sectionId=2521 State Committee of the Republic of Uzbekistan on Geology and Mineral Resources] * [http://www.unesco.org/ UNESCO] * [http://www.yncecs.gov.ye/ Yemen Geological Society]
===External links:=== * [http://www.yescongress2009.org/ YES Congress 2009 Website]

revision.text:
Super Sailor Moon is Usagi Tuskino's second [[Sailor Moon]] form. Her Sailor Fuku almost completely changes than Sailor Moon's fuku. Her collar is still dark blue with two (three in the manga) yellow stripes. Her belt has a yellow belt on top, and her back bow was coloured lilac, enlarged and extended. Her skirt was white, with a thick blue stripe around the bottom edge, and a yellow thick stripe on top of the blue one. She had wing-like barrettes in front of her [[odango]] covers. Her choker is yellow with a red heart motif. In this form, her attacks are Rainbow Moon Heart Ache and her new attack, using the Kalaidemoon Scope, Moon Gorgeous Meditation.
She transforms in sync with [[Chibiusa]], who transforms into Super Sailor Chibi Moon. This form of Sailor Moon is shown until [[Sailor Moon Sailor Stars]], when she transforms into her next form, Eternal Sailor Moon.

revision.text:
{{Infobox Spacecraft | Name = N-SAT-110 | Organisation = [[JSAT Corporation|JSAT]]/[[Space Communications Corporation|SCC]] | Major_Contractors = [[Lockheed Martin]]
[[Arianespace]] ([[Launch service provider|LSP]]) | Bus = [[A2100AX]] | Mission_Type = [[Communications satellite|Communication]] | Launch = 6 October 2000
23:00 GMT | Carrier_Rocket = [[Ariane 4|Ariane 44L]] | Launch_Site = [[Guiana Space Centre|Kourou]] [[ELA-2]] | COSPAR_ID = 2000-060A | Mass = {{convert|3531|kg}} | Orbit_regime = [[Geostationary orbit|Geostationary]] | Longitude = 110° East | Orbital_Period = 24 hours | Transponders = 24 J band | Apoapsis = {{convert|35789|km}} | Periapsis = {{convert|35784|km}} | Inclination = 0° | Mission_Duration = 15 years (planned) }} '''N-SAT-110''', also known as '''JCSAT-110''', '''Superbird-5''' and '''Superbird-D''', is a [[Japan]]ese geostationary [[communications satellite]] which is jointly operated by [[JSAT Corporation]] and [[Space Communications Corporation]]. It is positioned in [[geostationary orbit]] at a [[longitude]] of 110° East, from where it is used to provide communications services to Japan.{{cite web|url=http://www.sptvjsat.com/en/business/satellite/list/n_sat_110.html|title=N-SAT-110|publisher=Sky Perfect JSAT Corporation|accessdate=2009-08-11}}{{cite web|url=http://www.tbs-satellite.com/tse/online/sat_nsat_110.html|title=NSat 110|publisher=TSE|accessdate=2009-08-11}} N-SAT-110 was built by [[Lockheed Martin]], and is based around the [[A2100AX]] [[satellite bus]]. It is equipped with 24 J band (IEEE Ku band) [[transponder]]s, and at launch it had a mass of {{convert|3531|kg}}, with an expected operational lifespan of around 15 years.{{cite web|url=http://www.ucsusa.org/nuclear_weapons_and_global_security/space_weapons/technical_issues/ucs-satellite-database.html|title=UCS Satellite Database|publisher=Union of Concerned Scientists|date=2009-07-01|accessdate=2009-08-11}}{{cite web|url=http://space.skyrocket.de/index_frame.htm?http://space.skyrocket.de/doc_sdat/nsat-110.htm|title=N-SAT 110 (JCSat 110, Superbird 5 (D))|first=Gunter|last=Krebs|publisher=Gunter's Space Page|accessdate=2009-08-11}} The launch of N-SAT-110 was conducted by [[Arianespace]], using a [[Ariane 4|Ariane 44L]] carrier rocket flying from [[ELA-2]] at the [[Guiana Space Centre]]. The launch occurred at 23:00 GMT on 6 October 2000,{{cite web|url=http://planet4589.org/space/log/launchlog.txt|title=Launch Log|last=McDowell|first=Jonathan|publisher=Jonathan's Space Page|accessdate=2009-08-11}} and successfully deployed N-SAT-110 into a [[geosynchronous transfer orbit]], from which it raised itself to geostationary orbit by means of an onboard [[LEROS-1C]] apogee motor. Its insertion into geosynchronous orbit occurred at 03:00 on 14 October 2000.{{cite web|url=http://planet4589.org/space/log/geo.date|title=Index|work=Geostationary Orbit Catalog|last=McDowell|first=Jonathan|publisher=Jonathan's Space Page|accessdate=2009-08-11}} ==See also== *[[2000 in spaceflight]] ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:2000 in spaceflight]] {{communications-satellite-stub}}

{{db-web}} == Intoduction == '''The Association for the Study of Literature and the Environment''', ''ASLE India'', is envisioned as forum for the collective and intellectual pursuit of the human-nature nexus. Although the academic pursuit of the space that the human being inhabits—coterminous with the natural world—its intricacies and complexities have come to be interrogated in the academic circles in India (especially in the University circles) fairly recently after the historical evolution of ecological criticism (ecocriticism for short) in the Anglo-American literary and theoretical spheres, the roots and ideas of this fast-enlarging field of inquiry extends deep into Indian cultural and aesthetic history as well. Be its revelation through the much-critiqued Vedic and Upanishadic verses couched in the Sanskrit idiom, or its manifestations through the variety of regional writing practiced variously over this rich and antique land, the diverse array of Indian art and its practice, ecology and environmental wisdom has been the natural heritage of this part of the world. ASLE India works towards a resuscitation of this vision—not through mere rehashing and reiterating but through a self-conscious inheritance, a deliberate recognition of history and culture. ASLE India attempts to interrogate even the very foundation and theoretical underpinnings of this disciplinary inquiry. It is open to the interventions of like-minded and serious scholars and intellectuals. The official Website of ASLE India is www.asleindia.webs.com == Origin == [http://www.asleindia.webs.com/ ASLE India] was conceived on 15th January 2005 as a significant date- The first day of the Tamil New Year (the commencement of the harvest festival). it began with the meeting of a few scholars equally committed to nature and human nature. Its beginning marked the recognition of unity and diversity of universality and difference. == References == [http://www.asleindia.webs.com/ The official ASLE India Website]
[http://www.asle.org/ ASLE ]

revision.text: [[Category:Women's Professional Soccer teams]] [[Category:Sports in Los Angeles, California]]

{{notability|date=August 2009}} Susan Patricia Mary (Susy) Penlington was born on 2nd June 1966 at 25 The Meadway in Orpington in the London Borough of Bromley in London, England to Robert (Bob) Ivan Penlington (Accountant) and Margaret Mary Penlington (Physiotherapist).
At the time Susan had two siblings who were her brother Robert Nicholas (Nick) (1961) and her sister Diana Iva Ann (Dinny) (1964). A further sister Caroline Nora Jane (Carry) arrived in 1971.
Susan was married to David Dunham at St. Martin of Tours (Anglican) Church in Chelsfield in the London Borough of Bromley on (needs data).
Susan had two daughters by David. They are Lydia and Ella Dumham born on (needs data)
St. Martins Web site - www.stmartinchelsfield.co.uk

[[WP:AES|←]]Created page with '[[Image:Ggr-coach.jpg|thumb|right|"Polar Bear", Sea Lion Rocks Station]] Polar Bear is a battery electric locomotive built by [[Alan Keef]] in [[2003]] for the [[Gr...'
revision.text:
[[Image:Ggr-coach.jpg|thumb|right|"Polar Bear", Sea Lion Rocks Station]] Polar Bear is a battery electric locomotive built by [[Alan Keef]] in [[2003]] for the [[Groudle Glen Railway]] in the [[Isle of Man]], where it currently resides. It was built on the frame of a 1988-built vehicle of similar design (one of the last to be built) and has a newly-fabricated body replicating that of two similar locomotives that operated the railway between 1921 and 1926. The original was built by [[Wingrove & Rogers]] in [[1920]], and allocated works no. 314 and the operating replica is in original form. However, the 1920 version proved troublesome and within the first season had been modified to include bogies to reduce the uncomfortable ride. Further modification came with the addition of a battery truck that the loco pushed around, though the replica does not carry these later features.
==Bibliography== * {{cite book|author=Tony Beard|title=Groudle Glen Railway: Its History & Restoration|publisher=Groudle Glen Railway|year=1999|isbn=1-234280-04-X}} * {{cite book|author=David Smith|title= The Groudle Glen Railway |publisher=Plateway Press|location|year=1989|isbn=1-871980-00-X}} * {{cite book|author=I.o.M.S.R.S.A.|title=Manx Steam Railway News|publisher=I.o.M.S.R.S.A.|year=1966-2009|isbn=1-234280-04-X}}
==See also== *[[Isle of Man Steam Railway Supporters' Association]] *[[British narrow gauge railways]]
==External links== * [http://www.groudleglenrailway.com The Official Site] * [http://www.isle-of-man.com/heritage/transport/ggr.htm Groudle Glen Railway] * [http://www.iomguide.com/groudleglenrailway.php Guide to the railway]
==References== * {{cite book|author=Tony Beard|title=Groudle Glen Railway: Its History & Restoration|publisher=Groudle Glen Railway|year=1994}} * {{cite book|author=David Hyland Smith|title= The Groudle Glen Railway|publisher=Plateway Press|location=Brighton|year=1989|isbn=1-871980-00-X}} * ''Manx Steam Railway News'' Journal of the [[Isle of Man Steam Railway Supporters' Association]]

| prevseason_link = 1926-27 Northern Rugby Football League season | prevseason_year = 1926-27 | nextseason_link = 1928-29 Northern Rugby Football League season | nextseason_year = 1928-29 }} The '''1927-28 [[Rugby Football League]] season''' was the twenty eighth season of [[Rugby league|rugby league football]].
==Season summary== Swinton won their second, and successive, Championship when they defeated Featherstone 11-0 in the play-off final. Swinton had also ended the regular season as the league leaders.
The Challenge Cup Winners were Swinton who beat Warrington 5-3in the final.
Pontypridd resigned from the League after playing 8 games, and their record was expunged from the table. They won 1 and lost 7, scoring 46 and conceding 149. 1927-28. <ref>{{cite web|url=http://wigan.rlfans.com/fusion_pages/index.php?page_id=347|title=1927-28 Season summary|accessdate=2009-08-08|}}</ref>

==Championship Play-Off==
Semifinals:
Featherstone Rovers 15 beat Leeds 12.
Swinton 12 beat Hunslet 2.
Final:
Swinton 11 beat Featherstone Rovers 0.
==Challenge Cup==
Swinton beat Warrington 5-3 in the final played at Wigan in front of a crowd of 33,909.
This was Swinton’s third Challenge Cup Final win from four final appearances and coompleted a League and Cup double for the club. <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.therfl.co.uk/challengecup/page.php?areaid=65|title=RFL Challenge Cup Roll of Honour|accessdate=2009-08-07}}</ref>

The Tenth Council of Constantinople was held in Constantinopel between (1341-1351). Orthodox Christians sometimes call it the Ninth Ecumenical Council.
[[category:religion]]

'''LARS WESTMAN''' born 1938 filmmaker and cartoonist
Studies: Kursverksamheten with University of Stockholm (Art) 1963 Beckmans Reklamskola Stockholm 1964 (Art and Advertise) 1964 Swedish Television Producer-school 1969
Born in the north of Sweden, with four children and nine grandchildren. He has worked for ten years as a typographer, and has been involved in filmmaking for nearly 50 years, primarly for television in Scandinavia. Broadcasted more than 280 films in Sweden, Finland, Norway, Denmark, Germany, France, USA,satellite by Arte and Discovery Chanel. Three films for cinema in Scandinavia. Prizes in Canada, Germany, Bulgaria, Sweden, Brazil. Gained lifelong-stipendium for filmmakers in Sweden by the Swedish Cultural Ministry.. Bo Widerbergs prize for the total production given by SVT, Swedish Filminstitute, Swedish Filmlaboratories, Swedish Filmmakers Union.
One of the projects, a series entitled AROUND THE WORLD took him to 42 countries.He has lived in West Africa and maked 20 films about struggel and culture in Africa. He has depicted what the life of a seven years-old boy can be like if he is born with a serious skin desease (The Fish Scale Disease) in VICTOR, A TRIUMPH. Together with midwife Signe Jansson he made a film, often shown in maternity wards, whose aim is to make our start in life easier: BIRTH. He has filmed underwater births in the Soviet Union, several programs on drought and starvation in Africa during 1970´s, several films about child development I CAN, I TRY, I DEAR TO. A film about calligraphy and the role of art in China FROM THE OLD COMES THE NEW. Followed striking mineworkers in 1969-70 in COMRADES, OUR ENEMIES ARE WELLORGANIZED. Portrayed a radioctive accident in Brazil I HAVE CECIUM IN MY BLOOD AND I AM SCARED. As well the effect of Chernobyl accident in Scandinavia LAPS, MOUNTAIN AND RAINDEER.
He filmed his mothers life and death during 20 years, FACING DEATH. The building of the longest bridge in Europe between Sweden and Denmark WALKING ON WATER in six years for cinema and television. Films about art and poetry THE POETGENERAL, AMADO BAHIA, PICTURES UNDER THE SURFICE, WHAT IS THE DRAGON DOING IN SWEDEN?, FROM THE OLD COMES THE NEW. About the MSTs struggel for earth in Brasil OCUPAR, RESISTIR, PRODUZIR. At present Lars Westman is filming the roots of Shulamusic in Bahia, a second film about MST, following up the radioactiv accident in Goiania and a film about love for Scandinavian television, THE LOVEFILM.
Some of the films: TELEVISION 6 min DESERT ISLAND 6 min Prize in Mamaia THE BOX 5 min Prize in Mamaia DOTS 20 min BAKA BAKA LITEN KAKA 4 min 8 mm color Animated black and white 16 mm films 1959-65
THE BRIDGEOPENER 40 min black and white 16 mm 1963 About Biafra and the Atom bomb in the small country Sweden.
TO NOT SPEAK ABOUT TARZAN 40 min black and white 16 mm 1966 Monkeys and human beings at the zoo.
THE TRUTH ABOUT BÅSTAD 48 min black and white 16 mm 1968 Quality Prize Swedish Filminstitute About a demonstration against apartheid
VIET ROCK 48 min black and white 16 mm 1967 Quality Prize Swedish Filminstitute The work on a theater in Stockholm about Vietnam War.
WHAT DID THE CHINES SAY? Together with Sven Wernström 20 min black and white 16 mm 1963 First Prize Swedish Television. A Cartoonists life.
WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN? NOWERE. WHAT HAVE YOU DONE? NOTHING. 28 min black and white 16 mm1965. A childs dayly life. Fiction/documentary.
THE SCHOOL AT THE SEA Together with Sven Wewrnström 28 min black and white 16 mm1966 Playa Giron, Cuba.
THE SCHOOL IN THE MOUNTAIN Together with Sven Wernström 28 min black and white 16 mm 1966 Sierra Maestra Alfabetizasion in Cuba.
HABLA FIDEL Together with Sven Wernström 28 min black and white 16 mm 1966 Fidel speaks to one million cubans at The Revolution Square Havana, Cuba.
MAZORRA 58 min black and white 16 mm 1968 Mental Hospital outside Havana, Cuba.
THE LINE Workers situatione on L M Ericssons fabric in Sweden. 1969. Black and white 16 mm, 28 min.
SECUR? SECURITAS and ABAB, two companies working with security in Sweden. 58 min 16 mm color, 1970.
COMRADES, THE ENEMY IS WELLORGANIZED Together with Lena Ewert 93 min. black and white 16 mmm/35 mm First Prize in Porretta, Italy and Quality Prize Swedish Filminstitute. About a strike in a mine in the north of Sweden.
30 YEARS HAS GONE COMRADES Together with Fredrik Gertten, Uld Södergren. Following up the strike 30 years later 1980 58 min video color
TACKÅSEN IS FORGOTTEN Together with Mats Beckman 38 min black and white VIDEO1971 Migration to the citys.
LAVER Together with Mats Beckman 38 min black and white VIDEO 1971 A mine forgotten.
ITS CHRISTMAS AGAIN. 20 min black and white 16 mm1971 A lonely mans christmas.
YOUNG AND WILD Together with Birgitta Bergmark 58 min black and white and color 16 mm and VIDEO 1972 Car-born youngsters.
BISHOP HILL 20 min color 16 mm 1974 Swedish emigrants in USA.
CHILDRENS WORK In the glass industries in Sweden. 16 mm black and white 28 min 1974
DRYNESS, FAMINE, OPRESSIONE Together with Björn Kumm, Gudrun Schyman 48 min color 16 mm 1974 The Tuaregs situation in Sahel, 7 years without rain. Mali, Niger.
TANGOSI Together with Björn Kumm, Gudrun Schyman 28 min color 16 mm 1974 Portrait on a tuareg woman in a starvation camp. Niger, Tchad.
JOSIAH WATERSELLER Together with Björn Kumm, Gudrun Schyman 28 min color 16 mm 1974 Portrait of a man selling water in a slum area in Nima Accra Ghana.
CACAO Together with Björn Kumm, Gudrun Schyman 28 min color 16 mm 1974 Portrait of a girl working with cacao, Ghana
MARIAMA Together with Björn Kumm, Gudrun Schyman 28 min color 16 mm 1977 portrait of a girl in slum area Gambia
CORA 55 min color 16 mm 1977 Music film about the Griot Historyteller. Gambia
FULA 55 min color 16 mm 1977 Fula tribes music in Gambia.
FOOD AS A WEAPON 48 min color 16 mm 1977 Senegals biggest farmer and supermarketowner, alebanes family uses the drought situatione to enlarge his company.
RESISTENS, BALANG BAA NYANJI 48 min color 16 mm 1981 A Coup Detat in Senegambia.
THE RAPE OF NIMBA Together with Alf Westman 58 min color 16 mm 1980 Portrait of a black supervisor in the Swedish owned mine Lamco, Liberia.
IMAGES OF AFRICA Together with Dan Schyman 5 - 12 min color Betacam 1996 13 short films about dans, music, magic, theater, rituals, writings, songs and contemporary art for a Congress in Denmark. Ivory Coast, Benin, Ghana, Mozambique, South Africa.
PICTURES UNDER THE SURFACE 48 min color Betacam 1997 A CROQUI-LESSON 28 min color Betacam 1978 During ten years collected material on the process of making art with famous swedish concretist Lennart Rodhe.
WHAT IS THE DRAGON DOING IN SWEDEN? Together with Lars Berglund 58 min color Betacam1987 A chines Calligrapher living and teaching in Stockholm, Sweden.
OUT FROM THE OLD COMES THE NEW. Together with Pierre Björklund, Lars Berglund 58 min color Betacam 1987 Chines calligraphy and painting artist make art in front of the camera.
WHAT WE SOW WE HARVESTS. 48 min color 16 mm 1987 Uranium mining in Sweden.
ALERT! 58 min color 16 mm 1988 After Harrisburg nuclear accident, the security plans around the nuclear plant Barsebäck in Sweden and Denmark.
LAPS, MOUNTAINS, REINDEER. 28 min color 16 mm 1988 The effects on Sweden by the Chernobyl nuclear accident.
THE BIRTH Together with Gudrun Schyman. My sons birth 1979. 58 min color 16 mm. 58 min.
I TRY, I CAN, I DEAR, Five films 28 min color video about the first years progress to learn to sit, walk, eat, talk of my sons life, 1980.
DAYCEAR CENTER One year about childrens contradictions, color video 90 min. 1983.
AROUND THE WORLD Together with Janne Forsell 1989-1997 42 films 28 min color Betcam Poetic documentaries about food, music, art, religione, streets and roads, citys and villages in GREECE, EGYPT, INDIA, PAKISTAN, MONGOLIA, VIET NAM, THAILAND, CHINA, BALI,SINGAPORE, HONG KONG, SWEDEN DALARNA, AUSTRALIA, PAPUA NEW GUINEA, BORNEO, VANUATU,HAWAII, USA, ALASKA, SOUTH DAKOTA, MEXICO, BRAZIL, ARGENTINA, PERU, CHILE, CUBA, TRINIDAD, CAMEROUN, BURKINA FASO, MADAGASCAR,TANZANIA,FRANCE, ITALY, PORTUGAL, SCOTTLAND, SPAIN, ALBANIA, BULGARIA, RUMANIA, RUSSIA, AUSTRIA.
URUGUAI-MALMOE Together with Fredrik Gertten 55 min color Betacam 1998 Emigrants life in Sweden and Uruguai.
SAMBAFOOTBALL Together with Fredrik Ekelund 55 min color DVCam 1998 The history of brasilian football and how to save treetchildrens life.
WALKING ON WATER Together with Fredrik Gertten 93 min color DVCam/35 mm 2000 Building of a bridge Sweden-Denmark during sex years.
THE POETRYGENERAL Together with Fredrik Gertten 55 min color DVCam 2002 portrait of the poetry festival in Malmoe, Sweden and the manager of the festival Lasse Söderberg.
SILUETT, A AFRICAN JOURNEY Together with Fredrik Gertten 48 min color DVCam 2002 A swedish dans company in Tanzania.
RUA PAPA URBANO/ SAO PAULO II 26 min color DVCam 2003 A woman living in slum area in Salvador, Bahia. Honory Prize in Cine Eco Festival Portugal.
LULA, WE WANT LAND and AS LONG AS HUNGER EXIST
Together with Lennart Kjörling 50 min color 2006-2008 The MST struggel for bread and earth in Brasil.
CECIUM IN MY BLOOD Together with Zenildo Barretto 55 min color 2007 Following up of the Goiania radioactive accident 1987
DO YOU LOVE ME? Together with Niels-Pagh Andersen, Thomas Stenderup 55 min color 2006 My love relationes in my life.
GARRINCHA AND HOT DOGS Together with Fredrik Ekelund 55 min color 2007 Footballplayer Garrinchas swedish son take up the roots.
AMA DO JORGE The brasilian writer Jorge Amados work and life and death. 50 min video 2000.
ELEGY A tribute to violinista Nicanor Teixeiras music in Rio de Janeiro 2009 color video 59 min. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ On work:
THE WONDERFULL SOURCE 48 min color Betacam filmed 1987 The connection with african traditional art and Picasso, Matisse etc.
LUTA 58 min color Betacam filmed 1987 Master Class of Lutaplaying.
ROOTS OF THE SLAVERY Alex Haleys lies and the african history.
SCHIZOFRENIA My fathers life and Swedens Schizofrenia.
CLIMATE CHANGE The war on the water resources.
MATA ATLANTICA A forest once upon a time.
BASS MUSIC Jonas Hellborgs music and life in USA, Syria, Sweden, India.
CROSS AND VAGINA Lennart Rodhes and Gustav Courbets art.
SAMBABLUES The roots of Samba in Bahia Brazil.
MARIA AND HER LOVE A adopted brasilian girls life in Sweden.
ART AS SCIENCE With singer Sven Kristersson. 2009
TO LIVE WITH RADIOACTIVITY About cancer and leucemia in Sweden after Chernobyl accident.
SLEEP People sleeping around the world.
FUNERAL Funeral cermonies around the world.
HADARS TESTIMONY A miners life in north in Sweden.
MACUMBA Slave history and ceremonies in Bahia Brazil.
RAIN Poetic film about rain in tropic countries.
WHAT DO YOU THINK? My three year old sons thoughts and questiones.
IN A REFUGIES FOOTSTEPS About the first political refugie after II world war in Sweden. Roadmovie in Brasil.
IN THE COWS EYES The Swedish writer Sara Lidmans poetical struggel.
ELEGY A tribute to violinista Nicanor Teixeiras music in Rio de Janeiro 2009.
SCHIZOFRENIA My fathers life and Swedens Schizofrenia.
CHILDRENS LOVE Following my childrens love afairs during 50 year. 90 min
LIBERTY What are US doing in Liberia?
WHAT NY EYES HAS SEEN Retrospective around the world. 3 hours video color.

| prevseason_link = 1927-28 Northern Rugby Football League season | prevseason_year = 1927-28 | nextseason_link = 1929-30 Northern Rugby Football League season | nextseason_year = 1929-30 }} The '''1928-29 [[Rugby Football League]] season''' was the twenty nineth season of [[Rugby league|rugby league football]].
==Season summary==
Huddersfield won their fourth Championship when they beat Leeds 2-0 in the play-off final.
On 4th May 1929 the first Challenge Cup Final was held at Wembley Stadium. 41,500 saw Wigan beat Dewsbury 13-2.
Carlisle City fielded a team, but resigned after 10 matches and their record was expunged from the table. They won 1 and lost 9, scoring 59 and conceding 166. <ref>{{cite web|url=http://wigan.rlfans.com/fusion_pages/index.php?page_id=348|title=1928-29 Season summary|accessdate=2009-08-08|}}</ref>

==Championship Play-Off==
Semifinals:
Huddersfield 13 beat Salford 5.
Leeds 7 beat Hull Kingston Rovers 4.
Final:
Huddersfield 2 beat Leeds 0.
==Challenge Cup==
Wigan beat Dewsbury 13-2 in the first final to be played at Wembley in front of a crowd of 41,500.
This was Wigan’s second Challenge Cup Final win in their fourth Cup Final appearance. <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.therfl.co.uk/challengecup/page.php?areaid=65|title=RFL Challenge Cup Roll of Honour|accessdate=2009-08-07}}</ref>

[[WP:AES|←]]Created page with 'The Trojans Club was formed in 1874, initially as a rugby club. There are now four very active sections, Rugby, Cricket, Hockey and Squash, covering all ages from U...'
revision.text:
The Trojans Club was formed in 1874, initially as a rugby club. There are now four very active sections, Rugby, Cricket, Hockey and Squash, covering all ages from Under 8 to Seniors and both men and women, boys and girls. During it’s long and proud history, the Trojans Club has done much to foster amateur sport and has, over the years, produced many county and international players.
[http://www.trojansrugby.co.uk/]

revision.comment: [[WP:AES|←]]Created page with 'Four new venues have been introduced for the third edition of the IPL, which will run from March 12 to April 25 next year. The 60-game tournament will feature a thi...'
revision.text:
Four new venues have been introduced for the third edition of the IPL, which will run from March 12 to April 25 next year. The 60-game tournament will feature a third-place playoff between the losing semi-finalists as a qualifier for the Champions League and could also see the induction of ICL players. The IPL governing council, which met in Mumbai on Tuesday, has also decided to include two new teams from the fourth edition in 2011.
Nagpur, Visakhapatnam, Ahmedabad and Dharamsala are the new venues, hosting some games of the Mumbai Indians, Deccan Chargers, Rajasthan Royals and Kings XI Punjab, respectively. Hyderabad will stage the opening fixture between defending champions Deccan Chargers and Kolkata Knight Riders, while both semi-finals will be held in Bangalore. The venue of the final hasn't been fixed but the season will end five days before the World Twenty20 opens in West Indies.
Today's decisions brought good news for the former ICL players, though their participation is subject to the BCCI's formal approval. They will now join the gravy train, though their payout could be considerably less than many of their peers. They will be valued in two categories; Indian domestic players will be paid Rs 8-20 lakh ($18,000-45,000) while international players, both Indian and foreign, will be made available through auction.
The IPL will also make use of the services of the ICC's Anti-Corruption and Security Unit (ACSU) for the third season. The BCCI had agreed to draft in ACSU for the upcoming Champions League in October as well, at the ICC board's annual conference in London last month.
Another development for the new season was the reduction in the 'strategic timeout' from seven-and-a-half minutes to five. The timeout - which will be mandatory for both sides - will be split into two breaks of equal length with the bowling team opting for it between overs 6-10, and the batting team allowed to choose between overs 11-16.
At his press conference following the meeting, IPL commissioner Lalit Modi also outlined plans for Season 4 onwards. Two franchises will be added to the league, through an auction to be held next January, and the tournament will expand from 60 games to 94. The player auction for the fourth season, with a new salary cap, will be held in the summer of 2010 to allow squads to integrate. The 'icon player' concept will be done away with but there will be no change in the number of international players - ten in the squad and four on the field.
The second season was held in South Africa in April-May this year after the Indian government declined to provide security because the tournament overlapped with general elections in the country.

{{db-corp}}{{hangon}} == RGTS == ''' Remi Girardin Transport Services '''
<gallery> Image:RGTS_European_Transports_and_Removals.JPG|RGTS's vans </gallery>
A privately owned Uk and European transport and removal firm, specialised in small removals and light haulage, created in England in 2007 by a French expatriate, Remi Girardin, who has been working in Transport in both France and England since 1993<ref>http://www.rgts.co.uk</ref>.
With 5 vans, from 10 to 20 m3, they are assuring regular routes between France, the United Kingdom, Spain, Portugal, Belgium, Luxembourg, Italy, Germany, and the Netherland; mainly for private individuals (motorbikes, furniture, lugage, boxes, bags,...) and also in cooperation with European businesses.
RGTS is also working in cooperation with French, English and Spanish universities, offering work placements to students in international business programs<ref>http://www.bem.edu</ref><ref>http://www.hull.ac.uk/</ref><ref>http://www.urjc.es/</ref>.
The company has been rapidly growing over the last two years, thanks to an exellent reputation and dedicated staff now composed of 4 drivers, 3 English employees and 2 French interns.
Furthermore, they recently moved into new premises in Taunton, Somerset, owned in cooperation with '''The wright removal company'''<ref>http://www.thewrightremovalcompany.co.uk/</ref>, and composed of a large warehouse and brand new offices.<ref>http://www.yell.com/b/R.G.T.S-Removals+_+Overseas-Taunton-TA27DN-4920215/index.html</ref>
<references/>

'''René Abjean''' (born 1937) is a French composer associated with [[Breton]] revivalist choral music.
==Life== Born in Brest, René Abjean made his début as a musician in the choir of [[Plouguerneau]] in 1953. At 17 he created his first vocal work, as part of a choral group that was a cprecursor of the Bretob revivalism of Ar Baganiz and An Triskell, for whom he made many arrangements. He co-founded the Cercle Breton de Brest, and organised the ''Festival International des Cornemuses'' at Brest from 1969.<ref>Roland Becker, Laure Le Gurun, "La musique bretonne", Coop Breizh, 2000</ref>
In 1974, il published a monograph on Breton music, wrote for several journals and contributed the chapter on Breton music in ''L’Histoire littéraire et culturelle de la Bretagne''. In 1975 he took over the leadership of the Ploudalmézeau choir , and in 1977 of that at Folgoët. These were later reconstituted as the "Ensemble Choral du Bout du Monde", which he led until he passed it to Jo Le Gad in 1988.
In 1977, with Pierre-Yves Moign, he founded "le Centre Breton d’Art Populaire" in Brest, over which he presided from 1979 to 1981; he was also associated with the creation of Radio Bretagne Ouest (Radio Breizh Izel). He was a member of the New York Academy of Science from 1997 to 1999. He was decorated with the [[Order of the Ermine]]. He is married to Marie Kermarec.
==Compositions== Abjean has written numerous sacred and secular choral works, often in the [[Breton language]], such as the ''Missa Keltia'' in 1975, the [[cantata]]s ''Ar Marc’h Dall'' in 1979, ''War Varc’h d’ar Mor'' in 1987 and ''Kan evit ar Peoc’h'' in 1989. He has also arranged sea shanties. He regularly works with the ''Chœur d’Hommes Mouezh Paotred Breizh'', creayed in 1993 by his friend Jean-Marie Airault. 1999 saw the creation of the cantata ''Une ville vers la mer'' to words by Heather Dohollau; in 2000 he wrote with Christian Desbordes a cantata for the millenium, ''Kalon ar Bed'' to words by Job an Irien. The cantata ''Liñvadenn Ker Is'' was created for the 50th anniversary of the "fédération Kendalc’h". His 2004 cantata for the male choir "Mouezh Paotred Breizh", "Ce Pays vers la mer, Bro ar mor braz, this land and the sea" was recorded in 2005 and distributed by Coop Breizh at [[Spézet]].
==Notes== {{reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Abjean, Rene}} [[Category:Composers from Bretagne]] [[Category:1937 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:French composers]] [[Category:People from Brittany]]
[[br:René Abjean]] [[fr:René Abjean]]

McLean is a brilliant, unique, once-in-a-generation British soul voice and a hugely gifted songwriter. Fresh from writing and appearing with Chase & Status on their More Than Alot LP, McLean is busy recording his debut album alongside writer/producer Fraser T Smith (Tinchy Stryder's recent chart hits, James Morrison 'Broken Strings'#; producer/programmer Simon Franglen - famous for numerous worldwide hits including with Seal and Michael Jackson #'Earth Song'#; and acclaimed mix engineers Phil Tan #Rihanna, Usher, Mariah Carey# and Manny Marouquin #Kanye West, Alicia Keys#. First single 'Broken' has become a YouTube and web phenomenon amassing some 20 Million internet plays. Over 500 fans around the world #including people doing Gangster Crip-Walking routines!# have uploaded covers, routines and montages to the song. It's the first time people have uploaded covers of song that is not already a major chart hit. McLean has a rich musical pedigree his father is the revered Lover's Rock artist John McLean, whilst his cousin Bitty McLean had a number of Reggae hits including 'It Keeps Rainin''#Tears From My Eyes#'
[http://www.myspace.com/mcleanofficial]

Four new venues have been introduced for the third edition of the IPL, which will run from March 12 to April 25 next year. The 60-game tournament will feature a third-place playoff between the losing semi-finalists as a qualifier for the Champions League and could also see the induction of ICL players. The IPL governing council, which met in Mumbai on Tuesday, has also decided to include two new teams from the fourth edition in 2011.
Nagpur, Visakhapatnam, Ahmedabad and Dharamsala are the new venues, hosting some games of the Mumbai Indians, Deccan Chargers, Rajasthan Royals and Kings XI Punjab, respectively. Hyderabad will stage the opening fixture between defending champions Deccan Chargers and Kolkata Knight Riders, while both semi-finals will be held in Bangalore. The venue of the final hasn't been fixed but the season will end five days before the World Twenty20 opens in West Indies.
The decisions brought good news for the former ICL players, though their participation is subject to the BCCI's formal approval. They will now join the gravy train, though their payout could be considerably less than many of their peers. They will be valued in two categories; Indian domestic players will be paid Rs 8-20 lakh ($18,000-45,000) while international players, both Indian and foreign, will be made available through auction.
The IPL will also make use of the services of the ICC's Anti-Corruption and Security Unit (ACSU) for the third season. The BCCI had agreed to draft in ACSU for the upcoming Champions League in October as well, at the ICC board's annual conference in London last month.
Another development for the new season was the reduction in the 'strategic timeout' from seven-and-a-half minutes to five. The timeout - which will be mandatory for both sides - will be split into two breaks of equal length with the bowling team opting for it between overs 6-10, and the batting team allowed to choose between overs 11-16.
At his press conference following the meeting, IPL commissioner Lalit Modi also outlined plans for Season 4 onwards. Two franchises will be added to the league, through an auction to be held next January, and the tournament will expand from 60 games to 94. The player auction for the fourth season, with a new salary cap, will be held in the summer of 2010 to allow squads to integrate. The 'icon player' concept will be done away with but there will be no change in the number of international players - ten in the squad and four on the field.
The second season was held in South Africa in April-May this year after the Indian government declined to provide security because the tournament overlapped with general elections in the country.

revision.comment: [[WP:AES|←]]Created page with '== The Equality Trust == The [http://www.equalitytrust.org.uk/ Equality Trust] is an organisation that attempts to gain the widest public and political understand...'
revision.text:
== The Equality Trust ==
The [http://www.equalitytrust.org.uk/ Equality Trust] is an organisation that attempts to gain the widest public and political understanding of the harm caused by inequality. Compelling new evidence shows that large income inequalities within societies damage the social fabric and quality of life for everyone.
This evidence is documented in a book written in 2009 by [[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Wilkinson_(public_health) Richard Wilkinson]] and Kate Pickett entitled the [http://www.penguin.co.uk/nf/Book/BookDisplay/0,,9781846140396,00.html Spirit Level]. Based on thirty years of research it provides evidence on each of eleven different health and social problems: physical health, mental health, drug abuse, education, imprisonment, obesity, social mobility, trust and community life, violence, teenage births, and child well-being, showing for all eleven of these health and social problems, outcomes are very substantially worse in more unequal societies.
The relationships have been verified, wherever possible, in two independent test beds: internationally among the rich countries, and then again among the 50 states of the USA. In almost every case it is found that the same tendency for outcomes to be much worse in more unequal societies in both the international and domestic USA settings.
Evidence is presented on four other important issues. One is how achieving greater equality within the rich countries may contribute to tackling the inequalities between rich and poor countries. Another is a discussion of both the compatibility and relative merits of greater equality and economic growth as sources of improvements in the quality of life among rich countries. There is a page discussing how greater equality may contribute to policies designed to tackle global warming, and lastly, a page ([http://www.equalitytrust.org.uk/why/remedies The Remedies]) pointing out that there are many different ways of increasing equality in our societies.
The data used comes from the most respected international sources including:
• The World Bank • The World Health Organisation • The United Nations • UNICEF • The US Census Bureau
Much of this work has already been published in peer reviewed academic journals, and some of the relationships have been tested many times by different research groups using data for different societies. Details of the data and statistical techniques that are used are available on the [http://www.equalitytrust.org.uk/why/evidence/methods Statistical Sources and Methods] page. The Equality Trust argues that in order to gain substantial improvements in the real quality of life of the populations of developed countries it is necessary that differences in income and wealth are greatly reduced.
The evidence suggests that this will improve health, dramatically reduce the incidence of violence and a wide range of other social problems, improve the quality of social relations for the vast majority of the population, and make the task of developing sustainable economic systems very much easier.
However, the Trust believes that differences in income and wealth will only be reduced when there is a widespread public understanding of the benefits which greater equality can bring to everybody. A program of public education is essential to generate the necessary political will among the electorate and politicians alike.
The Equality Trust has been set up to fulfil that function. Their main task is to broaden and deepen people's understanding, change public attitudes and the climate of opinion, in order to bring more egalitarian pressures to bear on decision making in public and private institutions at all levels from the international to the local.
In essence, The Equality Trust seeks to:
• Promote employee-owned organisations and businesses; • Liaise with ethical investments funds to promote equality employers; • Commission research on equality issues; • Publish material relating to equality issues; • Lobby politicians and policy-makers at all levels; • Engage with all forms of the media to promote the equality message; • Give prizes at their Annual Conference for the best equality initiatives.

{{Infobox Military Person |name=Alfred Teumer |born={{birth date|1918|2|11|df=y}} |died={{dda|1944|10|4|1918|2|11|df=y}} |image= |caption= |nickname= |placeofbirth=[[Neustadt am Rübenberge]] |placeofdeath=[[Bramsche|Hesepe]] near [[Osnabrück]] |allegiance={{flagicon|Nazi Germany}} [[Nazi Germany]] |branch=[[Image:Balkenkreuz.svg|18px]] [[Luftwaffe]] |serviceyears=1934 – 1944 |rank=[[Hauptmann]] |commands=7./[[JG 54]], 2./[[Kommando Nowotny|Kdo Nowotny]] |unit=[[JG 54]], [[Kommando Nowotny|Kdo Nowotny]] |battles=[[World War II]] |awards=[[Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross]] |laterwork=}} '''Alfred Teumer''' (11 February 1918 – 4 October 1944) was a [[Germany|German]] [[Luftwaffe]] flying ace during [[World War II]] and recipient of the [[Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross]]. He is credited with 76 aerial victories claimed in over 300 combat missions. Alfred Teumer took command of 2. Staffel of [[Kommando Nowotny]] flying the [[Messerschmitt Me 262]] jet fighter. He was killed in a flying accident on 4 October 1944 at [[Bramsche|Hesepe]] airfield. His Me 262 A-1a (''W.Nr.'' 170 044 — factory number) had suffered engine failure.Morgan and Weal 1998, p. 24. ==Awards== * [[Ehrenpokal der Luftwaffe]] (12 April 1943) * [[German Cross]] in Gold (17 October 1943) * [[Iron Cross]] 2nd and 1st Class * [[Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross]] on 19 August 1944 as ''[[Oberleutnant]]'' and ''[[Staffelkapitän]]'' of 7./JG 54 ==References== {{reflist}}
* Fellgiebel, Walther-Peer (2000). ''Die Träger des Ritterkreuzes des Eisernen Kreuzes 1939-1945''. Podzun-Pallas. ISBN 3-7909-0284-5. * {{Harvrefcol|Surname=Morgan|Given=Hugh|Surname2=Weal|Given2=John|Title=German Jet Aces of World War 2|Place=London|Publisher=Orsprey Publishing Limited|Year=1998}}. ISBN 1-85532-634-5. * Obermaier, Ernst (1989). ''Die Ritterkreuzträger der Luftwaffe Jagdflieger 1939 - 1945'' (in German). Mainz, Germany: Verlag Dieter Hoffmann. ISBN 3-87341-065-6. * Scherzer, Veit (2007). ''Ritterkreuzträger 1939 - 1945 Die Inhaber des Ritterkreuzes des Eisernen Kreuzes 1939 von Heer, Luftwaffe, Kriegsmarine, Waffen-SS, Volkssturm sowie mit Deutschland verbündeter Streitkräfte nach den Unterlagen des Bundesarchives'' (in German). Jena, Germany: Scherzers Miltaer-Verlag. ISBN 978-3-938845-17-2.
==External links== *[http://www.luftwaffe.cz/teumer.html Alfred Teumer @ Luftwaffe Aces] {{DEFAULTSORT:Teumer, Alfred}} [[Category:1918 births]] [[Category:1944 deaths]] [[Category:German World War II flying aces]] [[Category:Recipients of the German Cross]] [[Category:Recipients of the Knight's Cross]] {{Germany-mil-bio-stub}} {{Germany-WWII-stub}}

The '''1931-32 [[Rugby Football League]] season''' was the thirty second season of [[Rugby league|rugby league football]].
==Season summary==
St Helens won their first Championship when they defeated Huddersfield 9-5 in the play-off final.
Huddersfield had finished the regular season as league leaders. <ref>{{cite web|url=http://wigan.rlfans.com/fusion_pages/index.php?page_id=351|title=1931-32 Season summary|accessdate=2009-08-08|}}</ref>
The Challenge Cup Winners were Leeds who beat Swinton 11-8 in the final.

==Championship Play-Off==
Semifinals:
Huddersfield 12 beat Hunslet 9.
St Helens 9 beat Leeds 0.
Final:
St Helens 9 beat Huddersfield 5
==Challenge Cup==
Leeds beat Swinton 11-8 in the final payed at Wigan before a crowd of 29,000.
This was Leeds’s fourth Cup Final win in as many Cup Final appearances. <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.therfl.co.uk/challengecup/page.php?areaid=65|title=RFL Challenge Cup Roll of Honour|accessdate=2009-08-07}}</ref>

[[file:Wahlkreis Tsandi in Omusati.png|thumb|Tsandi constituency]] '''Tsandi''' is a village and a constituency in the [[Omusati]] region of [[Namibia]]. It is situated in northern Namibia, on the main road MR123 ([[Outapi]] - Tsandi - [[Okahao]]).
Tsandi is the residential place of the [[Uukwaluudhi]] Royal Homestead.<ref>[http://www.nacobta.com.na/lists_details.php?cat_id=4&sub_cat_id=34 NACOBTA Trust entry for the Uukwaluudhi Royal Homestead]</ref>

{{Infobox Hurricane | Name=Tropical Depression Two | Type=Tropical depression | Year=2009 | Basin=Atl | Image location=Tropical Depression Two.jpg | Image name=Tropical Depression Two shortly after being declared | Formed=August 11th, 2009 | Dissipated=Still Active | 1-min winds=25 | Pressure=1006 | Damages=None | Fatalities=None reported | Areas=No land areas | Hurricane season=[[2009 Atlantic hurricane season]] }} '''Tropical Depression Two''' was the second [[tropical cyclone]] of the [[2009 Atlantic hurricane season]]. It formed out of a [[tropical wave]] that came off of Africa, which developed on August 11th, 2009.
==Meteorological History== Tropical Depression Two originated from a [[tropical wave]] that came off of Africa on August 8th, 2009. The [[National Hurricane Center]] took interest in it as it fought against [[Saharan Air Layer|dry air]], and after aquiring a [[Low-pressure area|closed low]], the National Hurricane Center declared the system Tropical Depression Two on August 11th, 2009.
==Preparations, impact, and records==
==See also== *[[2009 Atlantic hurricane season]]
==References== {{reflist}}
==External Links==

page.title: List of Ministry of Environment Regions of British Columbia

revision.text:
This is a '''list of Ministry of Environmemt Regions of British Columbia''', [[Canada]]. The provincial [[BC Ministry of Environment|Ministry of Environment]] administers environmental policy and has under its wing the provincial [[Fish and Wildlife Branch]], the [[Water Rights Branch]], the [[Pesticide Control Branch]], and other similar offices as well as the [[British Columbia provincial parks|provincial parks]] system. The Ministry of Environment's administration system divides the province into nine areas:
*[[Vancouver Island Region (MoE)|Vancouver Island Region]] **Headquartered in [[Nanaimo]], this region includes all of [[Vancouver Island]] and adjoining islands, plus the mainland coast in the area of [[Queen Charlotte Strait]] *[[Lower Mainland Region (MoE)|Lower Mainland Region]] **Headquartered in [[Surrey, British Columbia|Surrey]], this region includes all of the [[Lower Mainland]], all of the [[Sunshine Coast (British Columbia)|Sunshine Coast]] and adjoining areas of the mainland, and also the [[Sea to Sky Corridor]] ([[Squamish, British Columbia|Squamish]]-[[Whistler, British Columbia|Whistler]]-[[Pemberton, British Columbia|Pemberton]]) and the lower [[Fraser Canyon]] and adjoining parts of the [[North Cascades|Cascade Mountains]].
*[[Thompson Region (MoE)|Thompson Region]], also known as the Thompson-Nicola Region **Headquartered in [[Kamloops]], this region includes all of the [[Thompson Country]], [[Nicola Country]] and the upper half of the [[Lillooet Country]], including the [[Bridge River Country]], as well as the basin of [[Adams Lake]] (but not the rest of the [[Shuswap Country]]) and some of the [[South Cariboo]].<!--100 Mile House, I think, can't tell from the map-->
*[[Kootenay Region]] **This region has two headquarters offices, one in [[Nelson, British Columbia|Nelson]], the other in [[Cranbrook, British Columbia|Cranbrook]]. It comprises all of the [[Kootenays|West and East Kootenay]], including the [[Columbia Country]] and [[Big Bend (British Columbia)|Big Bend]].
*[[Cariboo Region]] **Headquartered in [[Williams Lake, British Columbia|Williams Lake]], this region includes all of the Central and North Cariboo<!--excluding 100 Mile House I think--> plus the [[Chilcotin District]] and the [[British Columbia Coast|Central Coast]] including the towns of [[Bella Coola, British Columbia|Bella Coola]] and [[Bella Bella, British Columbia|Bella Bella]].
*[[Skeena Region== **Headquartered in [[Smithers, British Columbia|Smithers]], this region includes the [[British Columbia Coast|North Coast]] from the [[Hartley Bay, British Columbia|Hartley Bay]] area northwards, the [[Queen Charlotte Islands]], and all of the [[Skeena River|Skeena]], [[Nass River|Nass]], [[Stikine River|Stikine]] and [[Taku River|Taku]] basins plus the [[Atlin District]] and portions of the [[Cassiar District]] and also western portions of the [[Nechako Country|Nechako]] and [[Omineca Country|Omineca Countries]].
*[[Omineca Region]] **Headquartered in [[Prince George, British Columbia|Prince George]], this region includes the eastern portion of the [[Omineca Country]], the eastern [[Omineca Mountains]], and the [[Rocky Mountain Trench]] from [[Sifton Pass]] to the vicinity of [[Valemount, British Columbia|Valemount]], and adjoining regions of the [[Rocky Mountains]] west of that range's main spine. *[[Okanagan Region (MoE)|Okanagan Region]] **Headquartered in [[Penticton]], this region includes all of the [[Okanagan]] plus the [[Similkameen Country|Similkameen]] and [[Boundary Country|Boundary Countries]], plus the main part of the [[Shuswap Country]] (excluding the basin of [[Adams Lake]]). *[[Peace Region (MoE)|Peace Region]] **Headquartered in [[Fort St. John]], this region comprises all of the northeastern part of the province beyond the [[Rocky Mountains]], plus the [[Rocky Mountain Trench]] north of [[Sifton Pass]] and the basins of the [[Liard River|Liard]] and [[Dease River]]s, excluding that portion of the Dease basin which is in the Skeena Region (namely [[Dease Lake]]).
==See also== *[[List of Forest Regions and Districts of British Columbia]] *[[Biogeoclimatic zones of British Columbia]]
==References== *[http://www.env.gov.bc.ca/main/regions.html BC Ministry of Environment - Regional Offices page/map]
[[Category:Geography of British Columbia]]

{{Infobox lake | lake_name = Agate Lake | image_lake = | caption_lake = | image_bathymetry = | caption_bathymetry = | location = [[Jackson County, Oregon|Jackson County]], [[Oregon]] | coords = {{coord|42|24|39.05|N|122|46|13.65|W|type:waterbody_region:US|display=inline,title}} | type = [[Reservoir]] | inflow = Dry Creek | outflow = Dry Creek | catchment = | basin_countries = United States | length = | width = | area = {{convert|216|acre|km2}} | depth = | max-depth = | volume = {{convert|4782|acre.ft|m3}} | residence_time = | shore = {{convert|3|mi|km}} | elevation = {{convert|1510|ft|m}} | islands = | cities = }}
'''Agate Lake''' is a [[reservoir]] located {{convert|1510|ft|m}} above sea level in [[Jackson County, Oregon|Jackson County]], [[Oregon]], [[United States]]. It is {{convert|13|mi|km}} northeast of [[Medford, Oregon|Medford]],<ref name="RRBP"> {{cite web | url = http://www.usbr.gov/projects/Project.jsp?proj_Name=Rogue%20River%20Basin%20Project&pageType=ProjectPage | title = Rogue River Basin Project | publisher = [[United States Bureau of Reclamation]] | accessdate = August 10, 2009}}</ref> just north of [[Roxy Ann Peak]]. The lake is formed by the {{convert|86|ft|adj=on}} tall Agate Dam, which impounds Dry Creek, in the [[Rogue River (Oregon)|Rogue River]] [[Drainage basin|watershed]].
==History== Construction of Agate Dam was authorized in 1962, started in 1965, and completed in 1966.<ref name="RRBP"/><ref name="Resource"> {{cite web |url=http://www.usbr.gov/pn/programs/rmp/agate/rmp.pdf |format=PDF |title=Agate Lake Resource Management Plan |publisher=[[United States Bureau of Reclamation]] |accessdate=August 10, 2009}}</ref> The {{convert|86|ft|m|adj=on}} tall earthfill [[embankment dam]] was completed by the Talent Division of the [[Rogue River Basin Project]], impounding Dry Creek. Two [[canal]]s were also built, diverting water from nearby Antelope Creek and [[Little Butte Creek]].<ref name="RRBP"/> A [[boat ramp]], four [[pit toilet]]s, a [[picnic]] area, and a [[parking lot]] were also built. All but the boat ramp and parking lot have been removed due to excessive [[vandalism]].<ref name="Resource"/>
==Statistics== [[Image:Agate Lake Map.png|thumb|right|A map of Agate Lake]] Agate Lake receives approximately {{convert|23|in|mm}} of [[precipitation (meteorology)|precipitation]] annually. [[Temperature]]s average from highs of {{convert|89|F|C}} in the [[summer]] to lows of {{convert|22|F|C}} in the [[winter]]. The average [[wind speed]] in the area is {{convert|10|to|15|mph|km/h}}.<ref name="Resource"/>
Agate Lake has an average surface area of {{convert|216|acre|km2}}, and an average volume of {{convert|4782|acre.ft|m3}}. It is located {{convert|1510|ft|m}} above sea level, although the water level fluctuates as much as {{convert|25|ft|m}} throughout the year. It has approximately {{convert|3|mi|km}} of [[shore]]line. The [[spillway]] has a capacity of {{convert|3300|ft3/s|m3/s}}.<ref name="Resource"/>
Agate Dam is {{convert|86|ft|m}} tall, {{convert|25|ft|m}} wide, and {{convert|3800|ft|m}} long.<ref name="Resource"/>
==Flora and Fauna== Dry Creek was [[Stream#Intermittent and ephemeral streams|intermittent]] prior to the construction of Agate Dam, and did not have any significant [[fish]] population.<ref name="RRBP"/>
==Recreation== Non motorized [[boat]]s are allowed on the Agate Lake. [[Swimming]] and [[picnic]]king are also popular activities.<ref name="RRBP"/>
The Jackson County Parks Department estimates that approximately 5,000 people visit the lake annually.<ref name="Resource"/>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *{{gnis|1135376}}

{{dated prod|concern = Personal essay, original research per [[WP:NOR]], unreferenced|month = August|day = 11|year = 2009|time = 15:35|timestamp = 20090811153543}} <!-- Do not use the "dated prod" template directly; the above line is generated by "subst:prod|reason" --> == Thesis ==
The general fountainheads of economic success continue to trouble many aspects of the economy as a whole, among them being fuel prices, credit liquidity, consumer confidence, and unemployment. The transportation industry is by no means secluded from this recessionary cycle and in fact can be used as a harbinger itself; when no goods are demanded, high inventories remain stocked and dismiss the necessity for much transport. Growth is expected to be recuperative as the global market in its entirety pulls itself from shambles. Although, not an economic boon scenario, year-to-year growth rates will be steady and indicative of a growth cycle. A caveat to this is that growth should not imply expansion of the industry, but instead a ‘convergence to the mean’; a boom-and-bust economy holds periods of irrational decline and inflation, yet also briefly sustain periods of normalcy, it is expected that 2010 will be a return to normal market behavior.
== GDP ==
GDP, interestingly, often mimics freight traffic levels; as it is a measurement of both the economy and the growth of that economy. Historically, US GDP consistently grows each year, however near the end of 2008 and beginning of 2009, GDP fell and, some might say, dramatically. During this period, GDP shrank 6% , a decline attributed to the compounding nature from the negative contributions from exports, and other declining investments, however imports, which subtract from the calculation, also decreased, mitigating the deterioration. GDP is forecasted to reach a value of 14,139 [UNITS] by early 2010; this is a level comparable to early ’09, but still 13% short of mid ’08. What this indicates is a smoothing out of the GDP’s volatility and demonstrates the beginning of a rebound.
== Index of Consumer Confidence ==
The index of Consumer Confidence is often used to predict future consumer spending and is drawn from a survey of 5,000 U.S. households. In mid-2009 the index was placed at 49.3 points, one of the higher levels in a year, but when looked on a larger scale another story is revealed. Mid-2007 index levels more than twice 2009 levels, hovering around 110 points. This implies that although mid-2009 is not as weak as before, it is still quite weak; it is estimated that a full recovery to mid-2007 levels won’t be existent until mid to late 2010.
== Consumer Pricing Index ==
The shipment of goods and products is inherently dependent upon those that want to consume the goods. The CPI can be used as an indicator to determine the underlying demand that fuel the logistical systems in this country, as well as the economy as a whole since consumer spending accounts for 70% of the US economy. The CPI right is rising slowly, yet using historical indicators one can assume the rise will be positive, but hovering around 1-2 % levels . As consumers’ nerves begin to calm from the financial shake-down and stock volatilities settle, one can assume economic reconciliatory patterns will emerge. This pattern will occur simultaneously at the top and bottom with executives rehiring and ramping up production and proletariat consumer will use their new-found discretionary funds to purchase goods, further emboldening the economy.
== Retail Sales ==
Strong sales are often the pull from demand that creates air in the sails of the supply chain; retail sales tracking is one way to measure this. Although, it should be noted this is often more of a confirmation of recovery than it is an indicator, as there is a lag time in consumer response to economic events. Mid-2009 retail sales levels are on par with the levels seen in the previous six months, which, in the very least, is a sign of mitigating decline. Yet, when compared on a larger level, once again a different picture is painted; mid-2009 float around $340 billion in revenue, while a year early sales were around $375 billion, a disparity of more than 9% for all retail sales.
== Manufacturing ==
Manufacturing clearly has an impact on the transportation industry by creating goods or materials that need to be shipped. Manufacturing as a whole is seeing less demand than in previous years. Some, more cyclical industries, may have planned for this by creating backlog for harder times, yet non-cyclical firms would have a harder time doing this. Regardless of planning, however, the demand has not been there. Yet as a recovery takes place the sector is expected to rise consistently each month, emerging from the $.3 billion recent downturn. The Purchasing Managers Index (PMI) is a compilation of data taken from a survey of several hundred US manufacturers and acts as an indicator of “on-the-ground” and near to mid-term expectations. An indication of growth would be a PMI above 50, contraction below 50 and any measure above 41.2 implies overall economic expansion. The PMI for the recent recession bottomed out at 32.9 in December ’08 and rose consecutively each month through ’09 to levels in between general economic expansion and the minimum for manufacturing-specific growth. PMI is expected to continue and quicken in pace to expansive levels.
== Manufacturing Inventories and Sales ==
In an effort to pursue the most efficient and cost-saving structure, businesses will often attempt to maintain close levels of inventory with expected sales. However, as an unexpected economic crisis occurs, stock is less liquid as sales simultaneously diminish, creating a wide and often displeasing disparity between inventory and sales levels. This is represented in the comparison between the 2008 and 2009 sale/ inventory correlation. In mid-2008 inventory was 122% greater than sales, which appears consistent with usual proportions, but by mid-2009 the relationship had grown to 146%. The illiquidity of the products turns this asset, which one has a future expected earning capabilities to a toxic liability that costs the owner money without delivering any ROI.
== Index of Industrial Production ==
It is as important to examine the flow of raw material, in the transportation sector, as it is to look at the movement of goods and products; The Index of Industrial Production is a good proxy to review the exchanges from factories, mines, and electric utilities. The index displays a consistent month-to-month decline; in fact at the time of this report seventeen out of the last eighteen months had been negative and had seen a total Industrial Production decline of as much as -13.6%. However, the contracting are slowing each month as well; indicating the emergence out of a trough and, possibly, a recovery cycle. The upward momentum out of the red is inclining at a very fast pace with a ratio of 2/1.
== Capacity Utilization ==
As a symbol of overall slack in the economy with a specific focus on the industrial industries the capacity utilization among manufacturing, mining and utilities is a strong indicator. This index refers to the relationship between actual output that 'is' produced with the installed equipment and the potential output which 'could' be produced with it, if capacity was fully used. In theory, the higher the capacity utilization the less room there is to increase production w/out having to build a new plant or obtain new equipment; indicating strong economic output. 2009 represented a new all-time record low for this sixty-plus year old index, with a string of monthly lows preceding it, dropping from a historical level safely near 80%. As a caveat to these despairing records, is the recognition of a beginning of stabilization near 62% capacity utilization where it will, presumably, bottom-out and begin ascension towards regular levels.
== Port Security Grants (as an indication of growth) ==
One might be able to use the number, and monetary value, of Port Security Grants issued by the Department of Homeland Security each fiscal year as an indication of the transportation’s industry expansion (or for that matter, contraction). As a reference point, seven grants were issued in 2006, three grants worth $567 million and two supplemental packets worth $260 million in 2007 and two grants worth $35 million in 2008. However, because of slowed global transportation, this number dropped to zero in 2009. Making note of this decline, more than $150 million in stimulus funding was appropriated to the Port Security Grant issuing organization, FEMA’s Grant Programs Directorate. This additional funding has the intention of increasing management capabilities of port-wide infrastructure and provide immediate relief to communities impacted by unemployment and poverty.
== Trucking ==
----
== Oil Prices ==
Debatably, the highest variable cost in the transportation industry is the cost of fuel. Oil prices have been volatile in recent memory, dropping down to US$34/barrel (of West Texas Intermediate, ‘WTI’, crude oil) in February ‘09 from ‘08 peak of US$145/barrel of WTI in July of the previous year. According to Energy Information Administration, an organization that offer official energy statistics from the U.S. government, has released data indicating a relatively stable projected price for WTI. 2009 prices are expected to average out around $70/ barrel of WTI, which will set the ending average $18 above the beginning average, indicating a convergence to normalized prices. 2010 is expected to bring prices further upward, albeit slightly, to an estimated average of $72/barrel of WTI; it interesting to note that this estimated price is very close to an averaging of inflation-adjusted WTI barrel prices for the years from 2006 up-to 2010; statistically signifying a convergence to the mean. This is significant to notice, since, as a whole, 2010 will, presumably, be a crawl to normalcy from 2008’s exaggerated market state to 2009’s plummeting economy.
== For-Hire Truck Tonnage Index ==
The trends in the FHTT index’s fluctuations imply a rebound, albeit a very slow and modest one. Tonnage levels have been dancing back and forth, although leaning forward, out of the year-to-year hole the recession produced for the industry. The industry is more leveling out than it is moving upward with tonnage levels expected to remain at current levels for the foreseeable future; probably caused by high levels of inventory still available in the supply chain. The current levels of inventory will continue to stall truck tonnage levels, but it unlikely to deteriorate any further due to modest growth.
== Long-Distance Shipping ==
----
'''Intermodal''' Intermodal rail volume is still expected to be in a declining state, but declining at diminishing levels each week, until the industry breaks free from just ‘turning around’. The levels of intermodal traffic from June 2009 (a historically average season) rested just below 190,000 intermodal units; compared to 230,000 units a mere year earlier.
'''Rail''' The most recent data suggest that rail traffic across North America is poised to rebound and expected to enter a growth cycle out of a depressed state of decline that saw levels twenty-five percent lower than in previous years. Because the rail industry is a cyclical industry and thus greatly exposed to economic fluctuations and commodity price volatility, the overall industry is going to be greatly depressed to a severe degree. An example of this steep decline is represented in the Class I Railroad Employment numbers, where employment is a function of the level of business; i.e. how much freight is being hauled? Recent levels of employment fully represent an industry in a trough. In a three-year span rail road employees have fallen by more than 17,000 people, with a steep drop in late ’08, early ’09. Considering all variables, however, US rail traffic is expected to begin emerging from 2009’s abyss, where rail volume was suppressed as low as 430,000 carload and intermodal units; whereas at this period in the four previous years, volume hadn’t been below 550,000 units. The rise, however, will undoubtedly be slow and by no means represent true industry growth.
'''Railroad Cost Indices''' The cost of shipping a product by rail decreased from 2008 to 2009 and is estimated to remain cheap through 2010. One of the more costly inputs, fuel, also fell by the highest percentage margin, a whopping 56.3%; other inputs such as materials/ supplies and wage/ fringe benefits rose slightly, but on par with usual rates.
== Air Cargo ==
Air freight is a unique sector of the transportation industry, in the sense that its service is focused on the speed and distance of product delivery, not cost or bulk; because of this, airfreight has high operating costs, which can cause a dilemma in the face of economic turmoil. Overall the industry is delicate from recessionary effects, despite the sector’s relatively stable demand; additionally high-levels of inventory are diminishing any form of growth. If 2009’s pace continues through 2010, it will take several years to return to early 2008 levels.
== Ocean Freight ==
'''Container Industry''' Freight prices have dropped as shippers compete for a declining number of contracts and new vessels ordered during the boom period enter the market, effectively increasing global container-market capacity by 10%. Rates will be near 1990 levels, Kolding said, pushing operating margins to “record lows.” The container industry, as a whole, is estimated to contract 9-10% in 2010. An even more atrocious number contextually, with volume already dropping 24% the prior year. Industry leader, Maersk, has said that the balance between supply and demand won’t be enough to make a satisfactory profit until 2015. The HARPEX Index , which measures all good transported by container, will presumably bottom out as the overall global economy begins to recover. However, at the time of this report there has been a continual downslide in the index to never before seen levels in the indices’ 20-plus year history. Alternatively, the Baltic Dry Index , which measures “the demand for shipping capacity in relation to supply of dry bulk [commodities]” has had been showing clear signs of reaching a bottoming out point and perhaps will spearhead the climb towards solvency.
In summation, when one examines data from the myriad of variables affecting the transportation industry, the sectors within that industry, and the economy as a whole, one can draw a fairly confident conclusion on the industry’s trend; convergence to the mean. 2010 will, undoubtedly, be a year of growth, but not expansion, where the economic indicators rise, but don’t signify development.

==Season summary==
Salford won their second Championship when they beat Swinton 15-5 in the play-off final. They had also finished the regular season as league leaders. <ref>{{cite web|url=http://wigan.rlfans.com/fusion_pages/index.php?page_id=352|title=1932-33 Season summary|accessdate=2009-08-08|}}</ref>
The Challenge Cup Winners were Huddersfield who beat Warringotn 21-17 in the final.

==Championship Play-Off==
Semifinals:
Salford 14 beat Wigan 2.
Swinton 11 beat York 4.
Final:
Salford 15 beat Swinton 5.
==Challenge Cup==
Huddersfield beat Warrington 21-17 in the final at Wembley before a crowd of 41,784.
This was Huddersfield’s third Cup Final win in as many Cup Final appearances.
This was the fifth Cup Final defeat for Warrington.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.therfl.co.uk/challengecup/page.php?areaid=65|title=RFL Challenge Cup Roll of Honour|accessdate=2009-08-07}}</ref>

{{db-corp}} '''Blitz Web Development'''
Blitz Web Development is a small business offering eCommerce Website packages to clients throughout the UK. The company, which can be found in Portstewart, began trading in 2007 and has many years experience in the Web Development business.
Blitz Web Development's prices won't be beaten.
The firm aims to supply businesses with a professional eCommerce website packages and has a fitted workshop. The expert staff ensure clients get top quality at very competitive prices. The service is intended to be cost effective every time.
Blitz Web Development has a satisfied network of clients, situated throughout the UK, including several large organisations.
